page.title: 07CROSSWAYS JUNIOR SCHOOL
page.content: Crossways Junior School has two hundred and thirty children aged seven to eleven years. It was opened in 1973 by John Craven and consists of eight classrooms, a large hall, resource area,kitchen and administrative rooms. There is also a large field and adventure playground. The school is well equipped with resources including three computers. The children are divided into seven classes based on age and are then taught individually, in groups or as a class. The school aims to provide a stimulating environment in which children will be eager to participate and will learn to organise their own work which may range from Mathematics to Art, from English to Science with Problem Solving and Topic work.
